content: What famous painting by Leonardo da Vinci, also known as "La Gioconda," is believed to be a portrait of Lisa Gherardini and is currently displayed at the Louvre Museum in Paris?

The famous painting you're referring to is "Mona Lisa." It's indeed painted by Leonardo da Vinci and is also known as "La Gioconda." It is widely believed to be a portrait of Lisa Gherardini, the wife of Florentine merchant Francesco del Giocondo. The painting is renowned for the subject's enigmatic smile and the atmospheric landscape backdrop. It has been on display at the Louvre Museum in Paris since 1797 and is one of the most visited and recognized works of art in the world.
